metadata.title: CVE-2020-23906 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
FFmpeg N-98388-g76a3ee996b allows attackers to cause a denial of service(DoS) via a crafted audio file due to insufficient verification of dataauthenticity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-23906` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra60 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec60 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavdevice60 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra9 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter9 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra60 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat60 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavutil58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libpostproc57 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswresample4 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswscale7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
